channel.title: [PHP] Dynamic Runescape Signatures

item.title: [PHP] Dynamic Runescape Signatures
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

I made one of these long long ago too when I was into PHP

my way was simple and always worked no matter how much updates runescape did from what I remember I would just use a php function called stripHTML(); or something like that which would remove ALL html code with <>'s only leaving the stat numbers stat names and stat xps then I’d put all that in a array and call it out in a loop to generate the png. I was the owner of runescapesig.clawz.com/sigsomething.php dunno forgot… now i just use it for backups.

found it! here is my old code i believe it still works only need to update the URL link.

$user = $_GET[‘user’];
$handle = fopen(“http://hiscore-web.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/hiscorepersonal.cgi?username=$user”, “r”)
or exit(“Unable to open hiscore table”);
$array; $stats;
while (!feof($handle)) {
$buffer = fgets($handle, 4096);
$temparray = array(rtrim(strip_tags($buffer)));
$array = array_merge($array, $temparray);
}
fclose($handle);

here is how to use it

foreach($array as $value){
if(strcasecmp( $value, “Overall”) == 0 )
echo “This is OVERALL LVL” . $array[$i+2];
elseif(strcasecmp( $value, “Attack”) == 0 )
echo “This is ATTACK LVL” . $array[$i+2];
}

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Dynamic Runescape Signatures
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

I did a script like this a looooong time ago for a website I used to develop. Since that site is now dead, I guess I’ll post the script in a day or two; gotta clean it up a little.

Features:

  • Grabs skills from highscores (they changed the damn page again, I’ll have to update accordingly…)
  • Allows user to choose background
  • OPTIONAL: disable ask for username to grab stats of, instead, will integrate with IPB and load the character name from a custom profile field. Also, require X post count/ user group before the system is usable to a member.
  • For any blank stats, allow user to put in a value (return an error if the stat they put in is > 30 or their total level adds up differently than what the highscore says, to prevent liars)

Read full topic
